revised_title: The Role of Oxydases in Plant Pigment Formation
tldr: The authors investigate the distribution of oxydases in plants and their role in pigment formation. They discover two localized peroxydases in the Chinese primrose (Primula sinensis) and demonstrate their relationship to pigment formation and color patterns in flowers. This research has implications for understanding the physiological roles of oxydases in plants and contributes to the understanding of Mendelian characters in specific plant and animal species.
